entities.name: professor umbridge
entities.description: Professor Umbridge is described as leaving the blackboard and settling in the chair behind the teacher's desk, observing them all with her pouchy toad-like eyes. (Excerpt: 'Professor Umbridge left the blackb oard and settled herself in the chair behind the teacher’s desk, obse rving them all with those pouchy toad’s eyes.')

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as turning to page five of his copy of Defensive Magical Theory and starting to read. (Excerpt: 'Harry turned to page five of his copy of Defensive Magical  Theory and started to read.')

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is described as absent-mindedly turning his quill over and over in his fingers, staring at the same spot on the page. (Excerpt: 'Next to him, Ron was absent-mindedly turning his quill over and ov er in his fingers, staring at the same spot on the page.')

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is described as not even opening her copy of Defensive Magical Theory. (Excerpt: 'Harry looked right and received a surprise to shake him out of his torpor. Hermione had not even opened her copy')

entities.name: professor binns
entities.description: Professor Binns is mentioned as someone whose lectures are dull, similar to the current lesson. (Excerpt: 'It was desperately dull, quite as ba d as listening to Professor Binns.')

entities.name: defensive magical theory
entities.description: Defensive Magical Theory is described as a book that Harry and his classmates are reading. (Excerpt: 'Harry turned to page five of his copy of Defensive Magical  Theory and started to read.')

relationships.description: Harry is described as reading from his copy of Defensive Magical Theory. (Excerpt: 'Harry turned to page five of his copy of Defensive Magical  Theory and started to read.')

Ron is described as staring at the same spot on the page, implying he is also reading from his copy of Defensive Magical Theory. (Excerpt: 'Next to him, Ron was absent-mindedly turning his quill over and ov er in his fingers, staring at the same spot on the page.')

Hermione is described as not even opening her copy of Defensive Magical Theory, implying she is also supposed to be reading it. (Excerpt: 'Harry looked right and received a surprise to shake him out of his torpor. Hermione had not even opened her copy')

Professor Umbridge is described as observing Harry and his classmates. (Excerpt: 'Professor Umbridge left the blackb oard and settled herself in the chair behind the teacher’s desk, obse rving them all with those pouchy toad’s eyes.')
